data.title: Cabaret Cinema – Rubin Museum of Art
data.meta_description: The Rubin Museum of Art is a dynamic environment that stimulates learning, promotes understanding, and inspires personal connections to the ideas, cultures, and art of Himalayan Asia.
data.text:
Featuring: Michael Caine, Julie Walters, and Michael Williams.

Introduced by Professor of English Education, Sarah W. Beck

Free ticket with a $10 K2 minimum.

Tickets are available for pick-up after 8:00 p.m. at the will call table in the K2 Lounge (limited capacity).

Mind Over Matter Trivia:

– In the original stage play, upon which the film is based, Frank and Rita are the only two characters ever seen on stage. Other characters that appear in the film exist by name only in the play.

– Michael Caine has acknowledged this film as his personal favorite and regards his performance as Frank to be his best.

– Willy Russell, who wrote the film, also wrote the novel and play upon which the movie is based.

Hours

Monday

Closed

Tuesday

Closed

Wednesday

Closed

Thursday

11:00 AM — 5:00 PM

Friday

11:00 AM — 10:00 PM

Saturday/Sunday

11:00 AM — 5:00 PM

The Mandala Lab is reserved for family programming from 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM every Sunday.

The Museum is closed on Christmas,

Thanksgiving, and New Year's Day.

The Museum closes at 5:00 PM on the Friday before Memorial Day, Labor Day, the day after Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, and New Year’s Eve.
